programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When an NCIS agent turns up dead and Kasie goes unaccounted for, the team must work quickly to find the killer.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: NCIS must investigate the secretary of the Navy when her husband claims she tried to murder him.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: After an unknown shooter causes chaos at an annual Thanksgiving 5K, time is of the essence for the NCIS team to find the culprit; Kasie joins Knight for Thanksgiving lunch at Knight's sister's house.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: NCIS investigates the death of a college student who was killed while running across the street and had connections to McGee's wife.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: NCIS agents from Washington, D.C., Los Angeles and Hawaii, in D.C. to attend the retirement party of a beloved Federal Law Enforcement Training Center professor, find themselves investigating his shocking suicide.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Parker discovers he's a victim of identity theft while investigating the unusual murder of a Navy ensign; Knight and Jimmy face hurdles in their relationship as their connection heightens.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Bobby rescues a woman from a vicious attack - but his noble action threatens to end his career when the attacker turns out to be a Sudanese diplomat.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and the team receive information a "Dirty Bomb" has been smuggled into the country. The agents race against time in a desperate attempt to find it before it is detonated.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: When an armored truck disappears, the team must track down the missing 2.4 million dollars - and the guards. Sue tries to bridge the gap between the deaf and hearing worlds.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull helps a professional video game player, who has been accused of intentionally losing a championship game, sue his former team owner for defamation.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Benny defends a whistle-blowing army analyst who has been court-martialed; Marissa forces the office to work without its usual technology to avoid being hacked during the case.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: When Bull assists the U.S. Attorney's office with a manslaughter trial against a real estate magnate, his penchant for winning goes into overdrive as he realizes the defendant is trying to use Diana to antagonize him during the proceedings.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: When a state governor and the co-owner of a skydiving company die during a jump, Bull helps the co-owner's brother and daughter fight a lawsuit filed by the governor's widow; Bull and his frequent trial collaborator are on opposing sides in court.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull risks losing his business when he fronts the money to help thousands of people bring a class action suit against a corrupt bank; Benny hurts the case by his attraction to a client and his anxiety over a secret he's keeping from Bull.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When prostitutes are murdered in Texas, their deaths seem to have religious overtones; members of the team are put at risk throughout the course of the investigation.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The investigation in Texas reveals a deep web of corruption; Garcia must save a friend.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates a series of murders with unidentifiable victims in Bakersfield, Calif.; agent Kate Callahan joins the team.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team members search for a vengeful suspect who was once abused; Garcia travels to Texas to confront the person she shot.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team goes to Colorado to investigate when a passenger jet crashes; the incident reminds Kate of a family tragedy.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A body is found covered in scratches, leading the BAU to believe that the person responsible has a chronic skin disorder.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A child reappears one year after he went missing -- but the team must work quickly when a trick-or-treater disappears under similar circumstances.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team has a difficult time finding a common denominator among several male victims in Montana; J.J. struggles with feelings about her sister's death.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a wealthy accountant is gunned down for secretly testifying against a notorious drug lord, the team's investigation leads Tiffany to ask for help from a friend who was formerly with the NYPD and is related to the dangerous crime boss.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: As the team works to rescue a 5-year-old kidnapping victim, Scola suspects the boy's mother isn't being forthcoming about why her son was targeted; Nina struggles to open up to Scola about matters in their relationship.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Maggie returns from medical leave and helps the team investigate two homicides: a law student and a young man with possible gang ties; an inadvertent revelation from Maggie causes OA to worry that she is rushing back into the job too quickly.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a deadly truck heist arms the killers with enough ammonium nitrate to construct a massive bomb, the team discovers a link to a terrorist group Maggie is working to infiltrate.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: A teen shows up at FBI headquarters with a large bag of fentanyl, seeking the team's protection from the men who shot his father; Nina goes to Scola with a proposal he is hesitant to accept.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The abduction of a young woman leads the team back to a cold case from 18 years ago, which pushes Isobel to reconnect with her old partner Jake and take another shot at solving one of her first cases at the bureau.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The team jumps into action when analyst Kelly Moran is taken hostage.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a mysterious bioweapon leaves two MTA workers dead and one injured, the team rushes to determine who is behind the attack and the location of their next target; Jubal's past demons begin to surface.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: It's a rough night at the table for Mike and some of his buddies on poker night. A wild card named Angel thinks he's getting hustled and tries his luck by pulling a gun on Hammer. After the last hand, the night turns to threats, theft, and even murder. Mike looks for suspects and an alibi while Barry Lawrence harasses him, Skip Gleason, and his other friends with a new scorched-earth policy against gambling.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Lila B. has earned Mike Hammer's attention for a number of reasons, not least of which is her intoxicating voice. But the beautiful jazz singer also has a dangerous side, keeping company with mobsters. When her beaux arrested, he's forced rat on his partners. The plot thickens when one of Lila's gentlemen called is killed and she becomes a suspect. With both the police and the mob on her heels, Hammer is determined to keep the songstress safe.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Lila B. is in the wind, terrified that she may have seen something to precipitate the murders. Mike Hammer finds a way to post bail and sets out to track the jazz singer down. But with Lila on the lam and Hammer on her trail, the death toll continues to rise and raise the cops' suspicions. Lila reunites with Johnny Dive, and both find themselves face to face with danger when mobsters get a hold of them.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and Sam work to locate a group of ISIS sympathizers aboard the USS Allegiance; Hetty enlists her friend to help obtain information from a Russian diplomat.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and Sam work with Navy Capt. Harmon Rabb Jr. to apprehend spies aboard the USS Allegiance; Hetty tries to neutralize a missile attack in the Middle East; Kensi and Deeks are trapped in a mobile CIA unit in Iraq while under attack.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Faced with multiple cases worldwide, the team splits up, with Callen and Sam working in Tel Aviv while Kensi partners with Department of Justice Agent Lance Hamilton in Los Angeles.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and Sam run protection detail for retired Navy Adm. Kilbride in an operation to locate a missing naval intelligence officer.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and Sam are aboard a ship that is placed under quarantine for possible Ebola exposure; Kensi and Deeks investigate the murder of a petty officer who recently departed the ship and is linked to the Ebola exposure.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Cruz forms a bond with a young immigrant boy he meets while fighting an apartment fire; Squad makes plans to prank the newest member of their team; Hawkins and Violet struggle to keep their relationship a secret.

programme.title: Chicago Fire

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Firehouse 51 must band together when one of its own is taken hostage.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Firehouse 51 tackles a fire caused by a dropped jet engine, and one of their own is accused of a theft related to the incident; Kidd and Boden disapprove of Kylie's potential new love interest.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A family friend asks Herrmann for some advice on opening a bar; tensions run high between Emma and Violet; Kidd struggles to keep her team together.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Mouch and Ritter work together to solve a murder mystery; Severide and Cruz tackle a food truck fire; Gallo goes to see Hawkins about Violet.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: The big wedding day arrives and Firehouse 51 welcomes Casey back to celebrate the joyous occasion; Emma's plans to replace Violet come to a shocking end.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Kidd and Severide's honeymoon is interrupted by a dangerous person from their past; Kidd's former academy classmate joins Firehouse 51; Brett and Violet reflect on their relationships.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Javi spends a couple of shifts at Firehouse 51; Kidd and Carver work together to help Carver's former boss; as Hawkins and Violet's relationship blossoms, Gallo turns his attention elsewhere.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: The Pittsburgh Steelers and Arizona Cardinals dueled in a Super Bowl for the ages that featured plenty of iconic moments. Arizona would not quit as they battled back from a 13-point fourth quarter deficit, only to see Big Ben Roethlisberger drive down the field and hit Santonio Holmes in the corner of the end zone for the game winning touchdown.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classics
programme.desc: Tom Brady leads the New England Patriots' comeback and a game-ending interception by Malcolm Butler at the 1-yard line seals the 28-24 victory.

programme.title: NFL Top 10
programme.desc: A look at the top 10 NFL plays to remember and some better left forgotten.

programme.desc: Find out about the best ever individual performances that helped secure their team the win.

programme.title: A Football Life

programme.title: NFL Deep Dive: How An Undrafted RB Dominated The NFL For 3 Seasons
programme.desc: 18 years ago an undrafted running back named Priest Holmes turned in the greatest 38-game performance in NFL history. In this episode of NFL Deep Dive, we take a look at some the most mind-boggling stats, records, and moments from Holmes' storybook career.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Jaguars defeated the Jets 34-24 to advance to the AFC Championship. Mark Brunell passed for 329 yards and two touchdowns, while Fred Taylor added 102 rushing yards, helping Jacksonville secure a crucial playoff victory.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: Documenting the lives of NFL players, coaches, owners and teams.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Redskins, led by Joe Theismann, came back from a 21-point deficit in the fourth quarter to win the game. but two controversial penalties and a late field goal helped the Washington Redskins reach a second consecutive Super Bowl.

programme.desc: Baltimore Ravens quarterback Steve McNair throws a 10-yard touchdown pass to Todd Heap with 34 seconds remaining to defeat the San Diego Chargers.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the 2002 AFC Championship matchup between the Tennessee Titans and the Oakland Raiders where Tennessee found themselves unable to contend with a lethal Raiders passing attack led by Rich Gannon and a defensive unit that repeatedly put the Titans in uncomfortable situations. The big win gave the Raiders a ticket to their fifth Super Bowl appearance.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Tennessee Titans didn't need another miracle. They just needed Eddie George, their defense and some help from instant replay. George scored on a 68-yard run on the third play of the second half Sunday to lead the Titans to a 19-16 victory over the Indianapolis Colts and a trip to Jacksonville for the AFC title game.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the 1996 AFC Divisional Round matchup between the Jacksonville Jaguars and the Denver Broncos where the Broncos were tied for NFL high in regular season wins with 13 and led by future Hall of Fame quarterback, John Elway. Jacksonville did not let any of that faze them, as they pulled off one of the greatest upsets in NFL history.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: After a brilliant career at Ohio State and with the Tennessee Titans, Eddie George starts acting for himself.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Tennessee Titans didn't need another miracle. They just needed Eddie George, their defense and some help from instant replay. George scored on a 68-yard run on the third play of the second half Sunday to lead the Titans to a 19-16 victory over the Indianapolis Colts and a trip to Jacksonville for the AFC title game.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the 1996 AFC Divisional Round matchup between the Jacksonville Jaguars and the Denver Broncos where the Broncos were tied for NFL high in regular season wins with 13 and led by future Hall of Fame quarterback, John Elway. Jacksonville did not let any of that faze them, as they pulled off one of the greatest upsets in NFL history.

programme.desc: Survival is the name of the game, with just over 100 players remaining in the European Poker Tour Main Event. Most of the €9.5m prize pool is still up for grabs, and reigning champ Simon Wiciak and Monte-Carlo finalist Rania Nasreddine can both make EPT history. (5/11)

programme.desc: There’s €1.5m for the winner of this special anniversary edition of the European Poker Tour. As Day 4 of the Main Event continues, the USA’s Rania Nasreddine is put through the wringer and a new generation of poker talent starts to make its mark. (6/11)

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Unsecured
programme.desc: Bobby, haunted by the infidelity of his ex-wife, enters a new relationship with Lakeisha while grappling with deep-seated insecurities. Unbeknownst to Lakeisha, his past resurfaces when a witness claims to have seen him involved in a murder.

programme.title: But I'm Married
programme.desc: Kimora, a top home designer, and Jamal, a construction mogul, tackle the twists of marriage and temptation in their bustling careers.

programme.title: Vegas Vixens
programme.desc: Detectives unravel the murder of a Vegas escort, uncovering buried secrets and exposing a sprawling criminal empire in the city's underbelly.

programme.title: 3 Way Poly
programme.desc: A young couple's experiment in intimacy spirals into a nightmare when they invite a seductive stranger into their home. Little do they know, she's a killer on the loose, and their lives hang by a thread.

programme.title: The Queens Court
programme.desc: An all-female underground organization rules every criminal activity in the city, and nothing can be done without their approval. Those who fail to comply are dealt with, by any means necessary.

programme.title: Tainted Waters
programme.desc: An unknowingly selfish mechanic, unable to save his failing business, agrees to take part in a four-man robbery. Now hiding out from the cops, he must survive the night in a room of people where he's not the most selfish.

programme.title: Romeo and Isabella
programme.desc: Trans woman Isabella has always struggled to find the right man, until she returns to her hometown and falls for the neighborhood bad boy.

programme.title: She Time
programme.desc: Bored with her life and fading marriage, a woman encounters an old acquaintance on a girls’ night out and begins an affair with him.

programme.title: One-2
programme.desc: Two young men, Tae and G, find themselves on the radar of two law enforcement officers after they get into a situation with a stripper.

programme.title: Lethal Love Affair
programme.desc: Career driven Kyrstal has convinced herself that her job is more important than a relationship, until she meets Zoey.

programme.title: Induced 2
programme.desc: A couple hires a new midwife, only to be stalked by a crazed woman who will stop at nothing in her attempt to steal their new baby.

programme.title: Gold Digga
programme.desc: Maneater Maxine has been living the high life, thanks to a string of wealthy suitors. But her next sugar daddy comes with a problem: his wife.

programme.title: For How Much
programme.desc: Justice offers his childhood friend, Nelson, the opportunity to dig himself out of his financial woes.

programme.title: Dreamer on Dreamer 2
programme.desc: Derrick attempts to break it off with his side-chick Keisha, but she thought she was his one and only. That is until she finds out about his fiancé Crystal. To get revenge, Keisha decides to befriend Crystal.

programme.title: Droppin Bodies
programme.desc: Julia, a mother haunted by a violent past, flees her old life to protect her daughter, Kelsey. But when Kelsey is tragically murdered by her boyfriend, Julia is left shattered and betrayed. Abandoned by a justice system that fails to bring her daughter's killer to account, she's forced to confront the darkness she once escaped.

programme.title: The Good Sister

Joey and Fury form a special bond and embark upon lifetime adventures at the Broken Wheel Ranch!

programme.desc: Josh captures a wanted recruit and returns him to the Army, but the Captain refuses to pay.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: In an effort to save money, Darlene and Ben, and Jackie and Neville head off on their joint honeymoon, where their cost-saving measures contribute to a tension-filled getaway.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Jackie moves in with Neville, he shows up to their home with an excess of animals from his vet office; Darlene and Ben argue Darlene is turning into her father.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene receives a promotion, but she quickly learns the fancy title is not all it's cracked up to be; when Louise loses her job at Casita Bonita, an opportunity arises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie must come to terms with her mother becoming ill; Darlene's job hunt proves to be more difficult than anticipated.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene, Ben, Becky and Beverly Rose move into the new house, where Darlene implements a new set of rules.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben get into a fight and ignore Becky's boundaries in the house; Dan accuses Jackie of losing all of their home videos.

programme.desc: Darlene has issues with Dan's plumbing work in her new house; Jackie tries to find a caregiver for Bev.

programme.desc: Darlene continues her search for a new job; Becky is desperate to spend more time with Beverly Rose.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.desc: Harris takes her anger out on Darlene; Dan and Louise spend an entire day in bed together.

programme.desc: Dan and Jackie take a road trip to a hardware wholesaler in Oklahoma; Darlene heads out of town and leaves behind a plethora of to-do notes for Becky and Ben.

programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: To become America’s next Junior MASTERCHEF, the top 14 home cooks head to the great outdoors for a chicken cookout. Hungry campers at the KIDS CAMP MASTERCHEF will decide which dish reigns supreme, and the winning team’s recipe will be featured in Family Circle Magazine. The losing team must face a coconut cream pie pressure test that proves to be not as “sweet” as it may seem. Find out who’s MASTERCHEF dreams will go up in flames.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 12 are in for a surprise when the kids from Kidz Bop arrive and put their twist on a mystery box challenge, deciding which ingredients the home cooks must craft into an elevated dish full of personality. Only one will win a huge advantage, forever altering his/or/her MASTERCHEF journey in a “blast from the past” elimination test. Find out who makes it into the Top 10.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: It’s a battle to the finish line when the Top 10 are tasked with a pasta race. The home cooks are divided into teams and compete to roll out the longest sheet of pasta as fast as they possibly can. The first team’s pasta sheet to make it to the winner’s circle will be safe and exempt from a high-stakes elimination test in which éclairs are the dish du jour. No detail will go unnoticed.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 10 participate in the season’s most crucial team challenge when the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR restaurant opens its doors to a special group of VIP female role models. The team that dishes up the most impressive meal will go straight into the Top 8, but it’s going to take more than skill to win over this exclusive group of guests. The losing team will face a Gordon Ramsay masterclass in which they will be tasked with replicating a three-Michelin-star-rated dish. See who advances.

programme.desc: The residents of a small town have begun dying under strange circumstances, leading young Mike (Michael Baldwin) to investigate. After discovering that the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm), the town's mortician, is killing and reanimating the dead as misshapen zombies, Mike seeks help from his older brother, Jody (Bill Thornbury), and local ice cream man Reggie (Reggie Bannister). Working together, they try to lure out and kill the Tall Man, all the while avoiding his minions and a deadly silver sphere.

After 35 years, another gang of teens (Andrew Robinson, Ami Dolenz, Soleil Moon Frye) robs the cabin of an old witch (Lilyan Chauvin). Using some blood and a spell taken from her house, the teens inadvertently resurrect Tommy's soul in the form of the demon Pumpkinhead (Mark McCracken). Enraged, Pumpkinhead goes after the teens who summoned him and the men who killed Tommy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's thoughts turn to spring when he gives recommendations for bulbs to plant that will thrive in pots. He also shows how to prune summer fruiting raspberries. In Norfolk, Frances Tophill visits a gardener who at 97 still gardens every day.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is the autumn equinox and Monty celebrates the season's apple bounty. Monty also plans for Christmas when he plants bulbs to brighten dark winter days, and he gives advice on planting garlic for the following year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to prune and train the summer growth of climbing roses and makes the most of the seasonal warmth by planting perennials and sowing annuals. Frances Tophill visits a viewer's garden to give advice on how to prune unruly shrubs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As April gets under way, Monty Don begins the process of reinvigorating his Jewel Garden where, over the coming months, he will be using plants which will give an evolving tapestry of colour over the seasons. Elsewhere, Carol Klein revels in the glory of one the world's most renowned camellia collections when she visits Mount Edgcumbe on the banks of the River Tamar in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty begins the process of taking out plants which are in the wrong place and either moving or dividing others. He also gives advice on making leaf mould from fallen leaves and how to use it.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plans for next year's fruit harvest when he adds gooseberries to the fruit garden he planted earlier in the year. He also divides and moves herbaceous perennials and advises on the best bulbs to plant now for cut flowers next year. Frances Tophill meets a couple who have filled their garden with tender plants and devised a meticulous method of protecting them over the winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As October progresses and nights become colder, Monty advises on what plants need protection and how to protect tender plants over the coming months. Adam Frost travels to Peterborough to find out about the work of a Children in Need project for disadvantaged and vulnerable children.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has ideas for pots which will remain colourful throughout winter, gives tips on how to protect tender banana plants and harvests pumpkins. Frances Tophill helps a viewer whose overgrown pond needs some renovation, Adam Frost visits a garden in Nottinghamshire where the season of winter highlights its design.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A new gardening year begins at Longmeadow and Monty reveals his new plans for the year as well as taking stock of any winter damage. As well as seasonal hints and tips he is embarking on a mission to reduce the use of plastic in his garden and starts by exploring alternative containers to use for seed sowing. Adam Frost brings his design expertise to a tiny back yard to demonstrate that no matter how small, with a bit of ingenuity, every space can count when it comes to gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going in his vegetable garden sowing seeds for a bountiful summer and growing some more unusual vegetables as well as recommending varieties of summer bulbs to plant in spring. Plus, Mark Lane creates a floral celebration in a container.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at RHS Garden Wisley in Surrey to learn from the experts there how easy alpines are to grow, which seeds are needed to plant a wildflower meadow and the best orchids to grow for each room in the house. Meanwhile, Carol Klein helps Britain in Bloom volunteer Michael Welsh, who is determined to bring colour to the former colliery town of Easington with a community garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows us how to plant pots of bulbs for fabulous summer colour. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is out and about looking at native celandines, Wordsworth's favourite flower. They grace our hedgerows and woods at this time of year. The wild strains are too invasive for most domestic gardens, but Carol finds a number of cultivated varieties that should suit most of us.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Despite the slow awakening of the garden, there are still plenty of jobs to be getting on with and Monty begins to divide ornamental grasses, gives advice on what to do with containers which are past their best, plants up a colourful alpine trough and gives advice on what to sow now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Toyota 2000GT and Nissan 240Z

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | A Jaguar E-Type story, and What To Do With a Late Friend's Car Collection?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hears some fun stories from the longtime owner of dilapidated Jaguar E-Type. Next, Tom meets a man who was made executor of his late friend's will. Specifically, he was tasked with managing his unique car collection.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Quickest Trucks and SUVs
programme.desc: Race 1: World's Quickest SUVs: Rivian R1S vs Aston DBX 707 vs Cayenne Turbo GTRace 2: Rivian R1T vs RAM TRX vs Aston DBC 707 vs Cayenne Turbo GTRace 3: Bronco Raptor vs G63 AMG vs Jeep Wrangler 392 vs Defender V8 vs Gallardo

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - 1970s Muscle
programme.desc: Chip Foose draws what his dream Chevelle would look like. Then he gives us his take on one of the most sought-after cars from the muscle car era, the Plymouth Cuda.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Underground vault at the Henry Ford, and 10 barn finds on one street
programme.desc: Tom gets a tour of the underground vault at the Henry Ford museum in Detroit, MI. Next, Tom comes across 10 interesting barn finds all on the same street.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tomšs in England! Finds AMG Mercedes, Pontiac Indy 500 Pace Car and more
programme.desc: Tomšs in England! Finds AMG Mercedes, Pontiac Indy 500 Pace Car and more.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa
programme.desc: 2023 Nissan Z vs Supra feat Elantra N, Miata, WRX, F-Pace SVR

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Original Big-block Camaros in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom uncovers RS and SS Chevy Camaros in a dusty building in Arizona. These vehicles were eventually purchased and their restoration process has begun, so Tom hops on Zoom with the new owner to see how the projects are going!

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Chevy Corvette ZR-1 and GMC Cyclone
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa starts off with the fascinating story behind the ZR-1 Corvette. After that, Jason dives into GMC Syclone, which was the world's fastest pickup truck... for 30 years!

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | BMW E36 M3 and BMW M1
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells you why the E36 BMW M3 is the one to have, even without a real M engine. And speaking of M cars... the back half of this episode features the amazing story of the first one, the BMW M1.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Subaru BRZ and Alfa Romeo SZ
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells us why the new Subaru BRZ does NOT, in fact, need a turbo by comparing it to the Mazda MX-5 ND2 Miata. Next, Jason dives into the story behind one of the ugliest cars ever, the Alfa Romeo SZ

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay - Hyundai Ioniq 5 N vs Super SUVS | Cadillic LeMans race car
programme.desc: Host Jason Cammisa races the Hyundai Ioniq 5 N against the Lamboghini Urus, Porsche Macan GTS, Jaguar F-Pace SVR and Alfa Romeo Grecale Trofeo. Next, he races Cadillac's Le Mans hypercar vs the Ferrari 296, McLaren 750S, and Porsche 911 Turbo S.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Toyota 2000GT and Nissan 240Z
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa dives into the story of Toyota's 2000GT, which was one of the fastest cars in history. Next, Jason gives us the fascinating history behind the Datsun (Nissan) 240Z.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The stories behind the Ford GT and original Ford Bronco
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa tells the fascinating backstory of the 2005-2006 Ford GT.Next, Jason tells the story of the Ford Bronco, from the first generation to the current model.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Bugatti EB110 and Volkswagen XL1
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the Quad-Turbo, V-12 Bugatti EB110. Next, he dives into a car most people don't know exists: the Volkswagen XL1, a car capable of 250 miles per gallon.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Best-Sounding Drag Race
programme.desc: Lexus LFA vs Porsche Carrera GT vs Audi RS3The World's Heaviest Supercars square off in this episode of Ultimate Drag Race Replay - with the brand-new, 700-hp Ford F-150 Raptor R racing everything it can.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Renault R5 Turbo and Saab 900 Turbo
programme.desc: Early turbo cars! In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells us the unique stories behind the Renault R5 Turbo, and the Saab 900 Turbo.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Corvettes vs. The World
programme.desc: We drag race the first-ever hybrid, all-wheel-drive Corvette E-Ray against two Italian Supercars: the Ferrari F8 and Lamborghini Huracan Evo RWD.After that, it's the 2023 C8 Corvette Z06 against a Porsche 992 GT3, a Ducati V4 SP2, and an Audi R8.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa: Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E and Mustang GT
programme.desc: In this episode of ICONS, host Jason Cammisa talkes about why the Lucid Air is a time machine. Next, he directly compares the Ford Mach-E and the Mustang GT... and how they both stack up against the Tesla Model Y.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Pontiac Fiero and Ford Taurus SHO
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa, we learn about the infamous Pontiac Fiero and the fastest, most expensive sedan Ford ever made... the Taurus SHO.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Merkur, Ford and the XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Revelations with Jason Cammisa feature untold stories of automotive legends. First, Jason tells the story of the Merkur XR4Ti and its Ford Sierra RS Cosworth cousin. Next, the Jeep Cherokee (XJ) takes center stage... as the best SUV ever?

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay - 2024 Mustang and 1990s Sedans
programme.desc: Race 1: 2024 Mustang Dark Horse vs Lotus Emira, M2, Supra, Camaro, ChallengerRace 2: The Fastest 5-Seaters of the 1990s - W124 500E v RS2 v M5 Touring + ND2

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa - Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E, Toyota GR86 and Ford Bronco Raptor
programme.desc: 4-episode block of the award-winning "ICONS" series with Jason Cammisa featuring the Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E, Toyota GR86, and Ford Bronco Raptor.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Quickest Cars
programme.desc: Lucid Air Sapphire vs. Bugatti Chiron Pur Sport vs. Tesla Model S PlaidLucid Air Dream Edition vs. Tesla Model S Plaid vs. BMW E39 M5 vs... a skydiver?Genesis GV60 vs. BMW iX xDrive50 vs. Ford Mustang Mach-E GT Performance vs. Tesla Model Y

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa features the stories behind the Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories of the Mk8 VW GTI and Corrado
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explains why he thinks the Volkswagen Mk7 GTI is a better overall car than the new Mk8.Next, Jason explore the gorgeous styling and impressive performance of the Volkswagen Corrado.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Porsche Stories: The new 911 GT3 and wild history of the 924
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa argues why the Porsche GT3 is now, unquestionably, the most important car in the 911 lineup.Next, Jason explores the wild history of the Porsche 924 and why it was never meant to be a Porsche.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa: Toyota GR 86, and GR Corolla vs. GR Yaris
programme.desc: In this episode of ICONS, host Jason Cammisa reviews the Toyota GR 86 by comparing it to the Mk8 Volkswagen GTI and ND2 Mazda Miata. Next, Jason compares the the wild hot hatches from Toyota: the GR Corolla and the GR Yaris.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Autozam AZ-1, Honda Beat, Suzuki Cappuccino, and Honda S500
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the legendary "A-B-C" Kei Cars. To wrap things up, he dives into the story of Honda's first-ever passenger car, the S500.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in America…the wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.
Kris Seymour and family target a couple big Kansas whitetails!

Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldn’t be right if we didn’t try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling “The River Farm” they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With the King of the Raven in full swing, Randy decides to have a doe challenge to close out the season. With a bunch of buddies coming into camp this next week is about to be full of Surprises.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are all hands-on deck at the Raven. Things are coming down to the wire with bow season just around the corner. With just over a week left they are trying to get everything wrapped up before the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff embark on a 20-day mission into the Everglades to find the invasive pythons that are plaguing the ecosystem. These apex predators have eliminated more than 90% of fur-bearing animals in their new home. Can they turn the tide, or is the Everglades already lost?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. Learn from the Chickasaw Nation about the history of this method that has been used by Native Americans for thousands of years.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaii’s coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff embark on a 20-day mission into the Everglades to find the invasive pythons that are plaguing the ecosystem. These apex predators have eliminated more than 90% of fur-bearing animals in their new home. Can they turn the tide, or is the Everglades already lost?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge

programme.title: Lost & Found
programme.desc: Sent to spend the summer on a remote and mysterious island, brothers embark on a thrilling treasure hunt to restore their family's lost fortune.

programme.desc: Based on the book by Alistair MacLean.

programme.title: Don't Knock the Twist
